text: Tissue - specific activity of the gammac chain gene promoter depends upon an Ets binding site and is regulated by GA - binding protein .

The <extra_id_0> gammac <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> chain is a subunit of multiple cytokine receptors ( <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-9 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> IL-15 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , the expression of which is restricted to hematopoietic lineages .
A defect in <extra_id_0> gammac <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> leads to the X - linked severe combined immunodeficiency characterized by a block in T cell differentiation .

In order to better characterize the human <extra_id_0> gammac <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and define the minimal tissue - specific promoter region , progressive 5' - deletion constructs of a segment extending 1053 base pairs upstream of the major transcription start site were generated and tested for promoter activity in various hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic cell types .
The -1053 / +34 construct allowed promoter activity only in cells of hematopoietic origin , and tissue specificity was conserved in all other constructs tested .
The region downstream of -90 appeared critical for basal promoter activity .

It contains two potential Ets binding sites conserved in the murine <extra_id_0> gammac <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter gene , one of which was found essential for functional promoter activity as determined by mutational analysis .

The functional Ets binding site was found to bind Ets family proteins , principally GA - binding protein and <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and could be transactivated by GABPalpha and -beta synergistically .

These results indicate that , as already reported for the <extra_id_0> IL2Rbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , GA - binding protein is an essential component of <extra_id_0> gammac <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> basal promoter activity .

Although <extra_id_0> GABP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is not restricted to the hematopoietic lineage , its interaction with other specific factors may contribute to the tissue - specific expression of the <extra_id_0> gammac <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
